content:
Here is an example of a healthy and balanced budget-friendly meal plan for one day:

Breakfast:

* Overnight oats
	+ 1/2 cup rolled oats
	+ 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk
	+ 1/2 cup diced fruit (such as berries, apples, or bananas)
	+ 1 tablespoon chopped nuts or seeds (such as almonds, walnuts, or chia seeds)
	+ 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup (optional)
	+ Combine all ingredients in a jar or container and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, top with additional fruit and nuts if desired.

Lunch:

* Black bean and corn salad
	+ 1 cup cooked black beans
	+ 1 cup frozen corn, thawed
	+ 1/2 cup diced bell peppers
	+ 1/2 cup diced tomato
	+ 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
	+ 2 tablespoons lime juice
	+ 1 teaspoon olive oil
	+ 1/2 teaspoon cumin
	+ Salt and pepper to taste
	+ In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well. Serve over a bed of greens or with whole grain crackers.

Dinner:

* Slow cooker lentil soup
	+ 1 cup dried lentils
	+ 1 medium onion, chopped
	+ 2 cloves garlic, minced
	+ 2 cups vegetable broth
	+ 1 can diced tomatoes
	+ 1 cup diced carrots
	+ 1 cup diced celery
	+ 1 teaspoon cumin
	+ 1 teaspoon paprika
	+ 1/2 teaspoon thyme
	+ Salt and pepper to taste
	+ Place all ingredients in a slow cooker and stir to combine. Cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours.

This meal plan provides approximately 2000 calories, with a balance of carbohydrates, protein, and fat. The overnight oats provide complex carbohydrates, the black bean and corn salad provide protein and fiber, and the lentil soup provides protein and a variety of vegetables. This meal plan also includes a variety of vitamins and minerals from the fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
